alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 11:36AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Van Buren and southern Jefferson Counties through NOON CDT... At 1135 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Batavia, or 12 miles southeast of Ottumwa, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Libertyville, Douds and Leando around 1145 AM CDT. Birmingham around 1150 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Stockport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
